Statuses

Class OffensiveStatusPerTurn

  • java.lang.Object
    • Statuses.Status
      • Statuses.OffensiveStatusPerTurn
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    OffensiveStatusesPerTurn.Poison

    public class OffensiveStatusPerTurn
extends Status
    OffensiveStatusPerTurn extends Status. OffensiveStatusPerTurn DOES tick per turn.
    Author:
    Kevin

    • Constructor Detail

      • OffensiveStatusPerTurn

        public OffensiveStatusPerTurn(java.lang.String name,
                              java.lang.String statAffected,
                              int effectStrength,
                              int duration,
                              int defaultDuration)
        OffensiveStatusNotPerTurn argument constructor.
        Parameters:
        name: - status name
        statAffected: - stat affected
        effectStrength: - effect strength
        duration: - duration of status
        defaultDuration: - default duration of status

      • OffensiveStatusPerTurn

        public OffensiveStatusPerTurn(Status other)
        Clone method, since it's parent Status is a abstract class we can't create instances of it. This is used in updating a hero's statuses to create a copy of the proper run type so we can still apply polymorphism. Why not a static factory method? Polymorphism doesn't apply to static methods.

    • Method Detail

      • updateStatus

        public boolean updateStatus(Hero hero)
        UpdateStatus written as a PER TURN method. If duration is 0 remove the status ailment. Else tick the status effect.
        Specified by:
        updateStatus in class Status
        Parameters:
        hero: - hero whose statuses are being updated
        Returns:
        boolean: crowd controlled or not, if crowd controlled must skip that heros turn.

      • applyStatusEffect

        public void applyStatusEffect(Hero hero)
        ApplyStatusEffect adjusts the appropriate statistic on the hero depending on the status effect. Since this is a OffenseStatus the amount is SUBTRACTED to the hero's statistic VS a BuffStatus in which it is ADDED. Reduces the duration of the status effect, if the duration is 0 it will be removed in updateStatus.
        Specified by:
        applyStatusEffect in class Status
        Parameters:
        hero: - who to apply the status effect to

      • clone

        public OffensiveStatusPerTurn clone()
        Clone method, since this is a abstract class we can't create instances of it. This is used in updating a hero's statuses to create a copy of the proper run type so we can still apply polymorphism. Why not a static factory method? Polymorphism doesn't apply to static methods. This method also displays an implementation of co-variant return type: the class type returned in an overloaded method has been changed
        Specified by:
        clone in class Status
        Returns:
        OffensiveStatusPerTurn deep copy with new time stamp to allow stacking
